instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00426: What is 820-00426? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
came in with no power and spot water damage and corrosion on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>. replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and the corroded resisotors and caps next it to it.  now am getting fan spin but no chime.  i tried with external monitor as well in smc bypass mode.

cpu-vcore - 1.8v
ppbus - 12.57v

cpu is getting warm.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Did you test for USB activity?
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> comes high?
Is worth to try known good BIOS.
Also try to start in safe mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
-sorry i did test for usb activity.  i get led light on usb drive but no blinking
-<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> comes high?  - 3.3v
-i've tried reading the bios, but it keeps giving me an error.  i'm suspecting this is problem since i'm having trouble reading the bios chip.  do i need an exact match of the bios or can i take one off an 00165 and program it with a 00426 bios. 
-booting to safe mode does nothing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Try any 8MB chip which fits there.
See at least if changes behavior.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
So got my new programmer tl866II Plus (i had old tl866) and programed it with a clean file found on: [URL]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a-vcore-present-fan-spin-chime-but-not-turning-on.59760/#post-63082[/URL]

Did i do this right?  Also still getting high fan spin and cpu is getting warm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Don't you have a chip from <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> scrap board?
Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
I have only one <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> dead board and i have already used the bios from it.
I checked <RESISTOR>R6120</RESISTOR>-6123 + <RESISTOR>R6130</RESISTOR>-31 traces to bios chip and jtag and they all have connection and ohms reading is normal on the resistors themselves.  Did I miss anything else I should check?

I plugged charger in and they all have power except for <RESISTOR>R6121</RESISTOR> and 6122.  neither resistor has any voltage when power is connected.  is this normal?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
There are more than 10 SPI resistors I think.
I can't confirm if this board is sensitive to exact SPI chip, but is better to discard using original brand code.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: i ordered a donor board.  ill update and let you know.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: got donor, programmed it with clean file and still same issue

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: i have led light but no flashing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Heat CPU and PCH with good quality flux.
There can be a problem caused by accumulated crap underneath.
